runs.comm: good start from Utseya but South Africa's very own Boom Boom is off with a boundary, half gliding-half-edging past the keeper for four
down the wicket this time but nothing expansive, just eased down the ground for one
rather than charge though, he simply turns this into the leg side for a single
Utseya strikes! The move to open with the spinner works! Boom Bust for Bosman! Just slapped it straight to mid-off!
starts confidently enough, punching straight to point
oops, poor fielding, reminiscent of South Africa's showing in the first T20. Sweep shot goes out to fine leg who makes a glorious hash of things and Prosper is thoroughly unimpressed
decent start from Masakadza, finding a good length and line, Smith crunches his big bat down in defence
good delivery once again, back of a length, not giving Smith any room to free his arms
the length here is good but the line awry, slipping down the leg side
oooh, almost a dream start for Zimbabwe, it was short and a touch wide, Smith cracked an airy cut just short of third man
too short this time and Smith has banged it to the cow-corner boundary. Really thuggish shot, bullying it away
top shot again! Smith expecting a fuller ball charges down the wicket and clubs a drive down the ground
good change of pace here, slower ball beats Smith outside off
another boundary for Ingram and South Africa are away now, slicing a cut shot through point
sliced again square of the wicket but this time point fields
Ingram stands tall and punches to mid-on
four more! Touch too full and swept away powerfully
better length this time and it's defended into the covers
gone! Lovely bowling! Just held it back a fraction, touch of air and dip, Ingram ran at it, and past it as he was done in the flight, went on and clipped middle
oops, don't bowl there, not with fine leg up in the circle, short and down the leg side, Smith helps it on its way for a boundary
too short again, and the line is poor, Smith wheels a pull shot to the square-leg boundary
oh dear, oh dear, oh dear... another short ball down the leg side, Smith gloves it down to the fine leg boundary past the hapless fielder up in the circle
much better this time, on a length and line and Smith defends
Smith runs outside leg stump to try and give himself room to free his arms, and in the end gives himself too much room to reach it
no movement here from the batsman! Just stand and thwack! Short and wide deliveries tend to end badly for the bowler
Duminy away, turning it into the leg side. Goodness me, Tatenda Taibu is sporting an insane face mask, indescribable
carefully defended back down the pitch
good bowling, excellent bowling, touch of air and Smith defends
touch quicker this time, smart bowling indeed and defended
Smith tries to manufacture something but advancing down the wicket, Utseya saw him coming and fired it a bit wider, Smith takes a single to cover
Duminy collects a single thanks to a mis-field at mid-off, ends a lovely over from Utseya
Duminy is nothing if not a man of style and he slides this down to third man with great elan
Smith is no man of style but has plenty of substance and over his career how many runs has he picked up like this, nudging into the leg side? Many, many I tell you
touch too leg sided again, Duminy clips towards midwicket
nicely bowled, a touch slower and very correctly defended down the pitch
enough of a leg-stump line for Duminy to fiddle this towards midwicket for a single
bosh! Smith down the wicket and clubbing through extra cover
that was absolutely filthy. Disgusting short ball and Duminy beats it like an egg-white through midwicket
single taken this time to deep cover, altogether a much better delivery
touch shorter, Smith gets back deep into his crease and defends
ah lovely bowling here, Smith wanted to charge at it but was beaten in the flight and forced to defend
big heave one-bounce to deep midwicket, Smith timed it well but, fortunately for him, not well enough
ooh, leading edge draws a double cry of 'catch it!!' from behind the sticks, but alas, nobody can

Graeme Cremer is on with his legspin, Zimbabwe seem to have a endless supply of legspinners, which is brilliant... Smith is the one in command here though, proving how young and snazzy he is with a reverse-paddle
this time it's worked down the ground for a single
worked away into space
bosh! Excellent shot, charging down the wicket and depositing this over long-on
Smith picks a gap, clubs the ball into the leg side and takes a single
touch of spin here for Cremer Duminy defends
nicely bowled, nothing there for Smith
Taylor strikes! Smith has gone trying to hack this into the midwicket stands, got a top edge and Cremer made a simple catch look very difficult before holding on at long-on
Duminy strokes this with perfect poise down to long-off for a single
Miller defends his first ball very studiously
oh! How did that miss!? Miller missed a full toss that crept just past leg stump and beat Taibu to go for four
good end to a good over, beating Miller outside off stump with a quicker ball
Duminy is content to take singles for a while, carefully prodding a good delivery to point
ooh, dropped I think, Miller getting a top edge on a cut shot but Taibu couldn't hold on
safer this time from Miller, knocking into the leg side for one
too short and too wide, we all know where they end up. The cover boundary
single taken into the leg side
well bowled here, touch of spin and defended carefully
another double-cry of 'catch' as Taylor induces a leading edge
carefully played into the covers, touch of spin for Taylor
very correctly milked down the wicket for a single
ah neatly done from Taylor, the batsman was advancing and it was slipped in much quicker
play and a miss outside off stump, good over
overpitched first ball and driven firmly down the ground where some sprawling fielding on the boundary keeps it to two
oh lovely shot, classy stuff from Duminy, getting inside the line and lifting it handsomely to the deep midwicket boundary
slower ball, and a touch shorter too, gets a glove from Duminy down the leg side
Miller drives very firmly towards the point boundary
bouncer to Duminy! That's what's always been his weakness, and he misses an attempted hook
much fuller this time, full toss in fact, Duminy very kindly only nudges it away for one, could have been a lot more you feel
short ball first up and Duminy adjusted well, he had decided on a reverse-sweep but ended up playing a reverse-pull shot, clearing the infield to collect four
nudged into  the leg side for a single
Miller happy to get Duminy back on strike, working a single into space
50 from Duminy! And well played too, knocks the spinner into space and ambles a single
shot! That's gone a long, long way! Miller down the wicket and smashing this high over the bowler's head. The onslaught may just have begun now!
dropped tough chance, smashed back at the bowler who stuck a hand slightly haplessly in the way of it, saved runs I suppose

starts with a low full toss outside off, which is not the worst option, Miller clunked it down the ground via a toe-end-slitting inside edge and manages to collect a couple thanks to some excellent running
bowled him! Off stump out of the ground! Miller attempted a big swish into the leg side but found nothing but thin air and Masakadza leaps to celebrate
single taken, driven nicely to deep cover
nicely bowled here, good slower ball outside off, has Duminy poking suspiciously at it
that's gone a long, long way! Duminy has clattered this over cow corner, another slower ball from Masakadza but this time Duminy was waiting for it
outside off stump, quieter end to the over as Duminy defends
Kuhn falls now, sacrificing himself for the cause. Important strike there from Mpofu, found a decent length and line, Kuhn got a big top edge and was caught by Taylor on the long-on boundary
lovely shot from Duminy! Expansive drive over cover, down on one knee and a good grimace to finish the shot
another drive over cover, didn't get as much of this but still enough to beat the infielder and take a couple
fuller, yorker length, Duminy swings and misses
good yorker again! Nothing available for Duminy as he plays and misses. Good death bowling this
ah good thinking, bouncer, Duminy jerks his head out the line alarmingly, but sadly for the bowler, it's called a wide
oh dear the wide has cost the bowler! The extra ball is a full toss that Duminy clatters over straight cover for four
Peterson away, slugging a shortish ball down the ground for a single to bring Duminy back on strike
top work from Duminy, giving a brutal lesson to these Zimbabwe bowlers, gets a fullish ball and smashes it in front of deep midwicket for four
low full toss again, Duminy powers down the wicket for another couple
slower-ball bouncer, executed quite well and Duminy can't quite time it, gets a couple to deep square
good delivery here, yorker length that is jabbed out to long-on
Peterson tries to reverse-dink this but it's a slower ball and he ends up lifting a gentle catch to short third man
poor start to the final over from Mpofu - full toss, Duminy is happy, smashing it to the deep point boundary to reach his career-best T20I score
wow! That is out the ground! Duminy clears his front leg and deposits this miles back over the bowler's head
dug in much shorter, Duminy jumped to try and hook, close to a top edge so the bowler appealed, all he got from the umpire was a signal for wide though
good delivery this time, yorker length and dug out to deep cover
Botha is away straight away, inside edging a drive to mid-on and scampering off for one
oh that was a gift from the bowler but Duminy accepted with grace and style. Leg-stump half-volley smashed into the stands over square leg! What an innings this is!
What a finish! Duminy cracks a boundary over extra cover to finish unbeaten on 97, the highest Twenty20 international score by a South African and it's left Zimbabwe with a mammoth chase
